attributes.action: Gym to stay open with covid restrictions throughout lockdown
attributes.additional_details: Mental health issues are rising. Most people use gyms and classes as a way to cope with mental health illnesses. Taking this away at this crucial time, will be life threatening to people more then covid may be. Gyms are a support community to many. Businesses are going to struggle, independent gyms may not open doors again, due to the impact of Covid 19. Please keep all gyms open
attributes.background: To keep all public gyms, independent gyms, classes and anything that is classed as a support network for mental health through the use of exercise and community support. Covid restrictions to remain in place, with current rules and regulations

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Keep gyms and leisure facilities open during any lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556956

Prevent gyms closing due to a spike in Covid 19 cases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333869

The Committee will be holding a debate on Covid-19 restrictions on gyms and sport on Monday 23 November. You will be able to watch the debate on Parliament TV at 4.30pm: https://www.parliamentlive.tv/Commons
